title: Meet Curtis Sliwa—a Big Apple Republican in a Red Beret
sub_head: How can he get elected mayor in a city that’s 7 to 1 Democratic? ‘I think it’s 8 to 1,’ he corrects.
body:
New York
If you want to run a fool’s errand, you could try to categorize Curtis Sliwa’s politics. Mr. Sliwa, 67, is the Republican candidate for mayor of New York. On Nov. 2, he will face Democrat Eric Adams, a favorite so overwhelming that many New Yorkers have already anointed him mayor. “I can’t tell you how many people say to me, ‘Curtis, I thought you lost,’ ” Mr. Sliwa says. “I tell them, ‘There hasn’t been a general election yet!’ ”
